translation: Ten years ago, when I worked and studied in the United States.
transcript: 十年前，我在美国工作和学习的时候。

translation: Because of my work, I used to fly from the eastern part of the United States to the western part.
transcript: 因为工作的原因，我经常从美国的东部飞往美国的西部。

translation: During the flight, I would sit beside the porthole, through which I could see clearly the land and admire the green circles on the fields.
transcript: 我时常坐在舷窗前，俯瞰清晰的大地，我欣赏田野上那一个个碧绿的圆。

translation: This is America's intensive farmland, which covers more than 3,000 acres, with the largest diameter of 1.6 kilometers.
transcript: 这是美国集约化的农田，最大的直径有1.6公里，它的面积有三千多亩。

translation: This is a good example of the most efficient breeding, cultivation and management model in the US.
transcript: 这里体现了美国最高效的育种、栽培和管理模式。

translation: Later, I visited many agricultural regions in the US, but I was particularly interested in the Central Valley of California.
transcript: 后来，我去了很多美国的农业区，我特别关注的是加州的中央谷地。

translation: This narrow, flat valley is sandwiched between the Sierra Nevada and the Coast Mountains.
transcript: 这个在内华达山脉、海岸山脉中间夹杂的一个狭长的洼地。

translation: And it stretches only 720 kilometers, or 450 miles long and, it is 60 to 100 kilometers or 40 to 60 miles wide.
transcript: 它的长只有720公里，宽600，60到100公里。

translation: This little valley is one of the most important agricultural regions in the US.
transcript: 就是这样一个小小的洼地，是美国非常重要的农产区之一。

translation: It produces half of America's vegetables, fruits and nuts.
transcript: 它的蔬菜、水果、坚果占了美国产量的一半。

translation: There are 300 million people in the United States, but its rural population takes up less than 2% of the whole population and its agricultural employment population is a mere 1%.
transcript: 美国只有3亿人，它的农村的居住人口不到2%，它的农业从业人口只有1%。

translation: That is to say, three million farmers produce one-fifth of the world's food, which can feed two billion people.
transcript: 也就是说300万个农夫打出的粮食，占了世界的五分之一，可以养活20亿人。

translation: To take a concrete example, the food can not only feed a population two times of the US, but a whole India.
transcript: 打个比方，它不仅能够养活两个美国这么多的人口，它还能养活整整一个印度。

translation: Why is America's agriculture so productive?
transcript: 美国的农业为什么这么高产呢？

translation: With this question, I went to Pennsylvania, Illinois, Iowa, Utah, Arkansas and Washington, all of which are agricultural states in the United States.
transcript: 带着这样的疑问我后来去了宾夕法尼亚、伊利诺伊、爱荷华、犹他、阿肯色和华盛顿州，这都是美国的农业大州。

translation: Therefore, American farmers have a relatively high salary, which is generally higher than that of the urban residents.
transcript: 所以美国农民啊，他的薪水是比较高的，他普遍高于城市居民的水平。

translation: For example, in Iowa, the farmers earn an annual income of between $50,000 and $70,000.
transcript: 像爱荷华，它那儿的农民年收入5万到7万美元。

translation: And some of them even make it to $100,000 to $250,000 a year.
transcript: 甚至有10万到25万美元的农民。

translation: So in the United States, the threshold for engaging in farming is very high.
transcript: 所以想在美国当农民，它的门槛是很高的。

translation: After rounds of investigation, I came to realize that the high yield is due to the extensive use of modern science and technology, especially the seed breeding.
transcript: 经过考察，我深刻地认识到，美国高产的原因是广泛地运用了现代科学技术，特别是农作物种子的良种化。

translation: In 2007, I ended my work in the United States.
transcript: 2007年我结束了美国的工作。

translation: And in 2008, I started my work at the Shanghai Academy of Agricultural Sciences.
transcript: 08年我来到了上海市农业科学院来工作。

translation: This is my team.
transcript: 这是我的团队。

translation: We have only 2 million mu or 1333.3 km² of farmland in Shanghai, but we adopt the most advanced technology in our farmland.
transcript: 我们上海只有200万亩耕地，但是它每亩耕地的科技含量是最高的。

translation: Last year's statistics reveal that Shanghai ranks first in the country in terms of the modernization of agriculture.
transcript: 去年的统计数字显示，我们上海的现代化农业水平全国排名第一。

translation: I mainly engaged in supervision and inspection tests of crop seeds and environmental safety, as well as crop nutritional fortification.
transcript: 我主要从事的是农作物种子与环境安全监督检验测试，以及作物营养强化的工作。

translation: A decade of research, learning, and investigation gives me a deep understanding of the overall situation of the Chinese agriculture.
transcript: 通过这十年的研究、学习和调查，我深刻地了解了我们中国农业的整体面貌。

translation: And it also makes me realize how important seeds are for a country like ours.
transcript: 也深刻地认识到在我们这样一个国家，种子是多么的重要。

translation: We are a large agricultural country, but we are not a great one.
transcript: 我们是农业大国，但我们并不是农业强国。

translation: Our food self-sufficiency rate falls short of 90%, and even slumps below 87%.
transcript: 我们的粮食自给率不到90%，甚至跌破了87%。

translation: The growth rate of yield per unit area only reaches 0.6%, but we need to produce 35 million tons of new food each year to meet our needs.
transcript: 我们的粮食单产增长率只有0.6%，每年需要打出3500万吨新增的粮食才能满足我们的需求。

translation: Since 2012, we have imported six crops such as grain, oil and cotton.
transcript: 从2012年开始，我们的粮油棉六大作物全面进口。

translation: We are the world's largest importer of soybeans, cotton and rice, and a major importer of corn, wheat and canola.
transcript: 我们是世界上最大的大豆、棉花、水稻进口国，也是玉米、小麦、油菜的主要进口国。

translation: But in 1997, we were the world's major exporter of rice and wheat.
transcript: 而在1997年，我们是世界上主要的水稻、小麦的出口国啊。

translation: Currently, the red line of the total arable land is set at no less than 1.8 billion mu or 120 million hectares.
transcript: 我们的耕地面积现在是保证18亿亩红线。

translation: But last year only 1.6 billion mu was cultivated.
transcript: 去年种了16亿亩。

translation: Currently the arable land is 123 million mu less than that of 1997.
transcript: 我们现在比1997年少了1.23亿亩。

translation: With one-fifth of the world's population, we need 20% of the world's cultivated land.
transcript: 我们占世界20%的人口，需要世界上20%的耕地来养活。

translation: And 24.7% or even 25% of grain and oil to feed ourselves.
transcript: 同时，需要24.7%，甚至25%的粮油来养活。

translation: We often say that we should hold the rice bowl tightly in our hands.
transcript: 我们常常说，要把饭碗紧紧地端在自己的手里。

translation: More than any other time in history, we now urgently need high-quality seeds to achieve this goal.
transcript: 此刻我们比任何时候都迫切地需要优良的种子来实现这一目标。

translation: But how to obtain quality seeds?
transcript: 但是如何获得优良的种子呢？

translation: Ever since the crop seeds were discovered, human beings have tried endlessly to find quality seeds for tens of thousands of years.
transcript: 从农作物种子发现的那一刻起，人类上下求索了上万年。

translation: 10,000 years ago, rice and wheat were like grasses.
transcript: 一万年前的水稻和小麦就像一根儿草。

translation: And 5,300 years ago, when Mexicans discovered the corn.
transcript: 五千三百年前，墨西哥人发现玉米的时候。

translation: It was only as small as the little finger.
transcript: 它只有我们小拇指这么粗。

translation: The Dutch were among the first to discover the carrot, which was purple at that time.
transcript: 荷兰人发现最早的胡萝卜，它是紫色的。

translation: After endless trials, the Dutch breeders managed to transform the purple carrots into the orange variety, the same color as their national flag.
transcript: 荷兰的育种学家经过不断地努力，终于把这个紫色的胡萝卜育成了橙色的，那是他们国旗的颜色。

translation: They are very patriotic because the color orange is the symbol of the Dutch royal family.
transcript: 他们非常爱国，荷兰王室的象征就是橙色。

translation: It is the endless efforts of breeders that accelerate the development of seeds.
transcript: 正是育种学学家前赴后继的努力，加速了种子进程。

translation: Actually, the seeds of all our current agricultural products are quite different from their original appearance, but they are full of vitality.
transcript: 我们现在看到的所有农产品的种子都脱离了它原始的面貌，但是生机勃勃。

translation: Which means that nature is dynamic, and it is not static.
transcript: 也就是说自然是动态的，它不是一成不变的。

translation: Norman Borlaug, a famous American breeder, led the first Green Revolution.
transcript: 美国著名的育种学家Norman Borlaug，他领导了第一次绿色革命。

translation: A dwarf spring-wheat variety he bred saved one billion people in the Indian Subcontinent from starvation.
transcript: 他育成的矮秆小麦拯救了南亚次大陆10亿人。

translation: Therefore, he won the 1970 Nobel Peace Prize, which is the first time such a prize was awarded to an agricultural scientist.
transcript: 因此，他获得了1970年的诺贝尔和平奖，这是诺贝尔和平奖第一次授予一个农业科学家。

translation: In 1986, he established the World Food Prize, which has become the vane of the food and seeds development in the world.
transcript: 他在1986年设立了世界粮食奖，这是世界粮食发展的、种子发展的风向标。

translation: In 2004, Yuan Longping was awarded the World Food Prize for his great contribution to breeding hybrid rice varieties.
transcript: 2004年袁隆平先生获得了世界粮食奖，以表彰他在杂交育种水稻作出的巨大的贡献。

translation: In 2013, the prize went to three scientists who pioneered the use of genetic engineering techniques in agriculture.
transcript: 2013年世界粮食奖授予了把基因工程技术搬入到农业应用领域的三位科学先驱。

translation: In 2006, the honor was awarded to four scientists in nutritional fortification of crops.
transcript: 2006年世界粮食奖授予了四位作物营养强化领域的科学家。

translation: Who granted 10 million people access to adequately nutritious food.
transcript: 他们让世界上1000万人获得了营养充足的粮食。

translation: The prizes of the World Food Prize in the field of breeding also represent the goal of breeding.
transcript: 世界粮食奖在育种领域里的颁奖进程，也代表着我们育种的发展目标。

translation: What is it?
transcript: 是什么呢？

translation: It's to improve the quantity and quality of food in the world.
transcript: 是吃得饱、吃得好，而且要吃得健康。

translation: Chemical agriculture has made huge contributions to improving the quantity of food, but it also brings heavy burdens.
transcript: 为了吃得饱，化学农业做出了巨大贡献，也带来了沉重的负担。

translation: In 2016, China produced 70 million tons of chemical fertilizers and 3.77 million tons of pesticides.
transcript: 2016年我国生产了7千万吨化肥和377万吨农药。

translation: Half of them were exported, and the other half went to our fields.
transcript: 除了一半出口以外，另外一半打到了我们的田间。

translation: The invisible 'haze' in the soil and water is much more serious than haze in the air, posing a potential threat to our health.
transcript: 我们的土壤和水流里，有看不见的雾霾，严重于我们的头顶，潜在地威胁着我们的健康。

translation: For example, only 0.1% of the insecticide has an effect on the pests, and 99% goes to the field, flowing into the water.
transcript: 比如杀虫剂，作用在害虫身上的杀虫剂只有0.1%，99%的杀虫剂都打入田间，流入了水流。

translation: The soil is also overloaded.
transcript: 我们的土壤的负载也很严重啊。

translation: To maintain high yields every year, we have to draw on agricultural chemicals.
transcript: 年年要高产，不得不投入化学投入品。

translation: Therefore, the organic matter in our soil is only a quarter of that in developed countries.
transcript: 所以我们的土壤的有机质含量只有发达国家的四分之一。

translation: But can we drop the use of pesticides and fertilizers?
transcript: 我们能不要农药和化肥吗？

translation: They are good things, and they contribute a lot to our food harvest.
transcript: 它是好东西，它对我们粮食丰收的贡献非常之巨大。

translation: With a 40% contribution to food, and a 45% or even 50% contribution to vegetables.
transcript: 它对粮食的贡献达到40%，对蔬菜的贡献45%，乃至50%。

translation: But currently a trendy model of green agriculture has taken hold across the world.
transcript: 但是世界上现在兴起绿色农业生产模式。

translation: In the field of fertilizers, the initiative of replacing chemical fertilizers with organic ones has been fully rolled out.
transcript: 在化肥领域，有机肥替代化肥这个行动全面铺开。

translation: In developed countries, organic fertilizers have replaced more than 40% of chemical fertilizers, 76% in Japan, 70% in the US, and 40% in France and Italy.
transcript: 在发达国家有机肥替代化肥达到40%以上，在日本达到76%，美国70%，法国和意大利40%。

translation: But in China, that number is a mere 5%, and the products are of different qualities.
transcript: 而我们只有5%，而且产品参差不齐。

translation: To develop green agriculture, we have to replace the chemical production models with green ones.
transcript: 要发展绿色农业，我们必须要用绿色生产方式替代化学生产方式。

translation: The core of the development is the seeds.
transcript: 我们讲绿色农业的核心是种子。

translation: The core of breeding lies in its hereditary nature.
transcript: 育种的核心，在于它的遗传性。

translation: The core of cultivation lies in its physiology.
transcript: 而栽培的核心基础，在于它的生理性。

translation: By hereditary, we mean we have to understand the nature of the genes of the seeds.
transcript: 遗传性讲的就是，我们要了解它基因的特征。

translation: But by physiology, we mean we have to make a friendly, harmonious combination of the seeds and the environment, promoting mutual development.
transcript: 而生理性我们要让种子和环境友好地结合，共同地发展。

translation: If one day, the orange planted in the north can be as sweet and delicious as that in the south.
transcript: 如果有一天，我们把南方的柑橘种到北方，也一样甘甜可口。

translation: The idiom "South Orange and North-Trifoliate Orange" will become a thing of the past.
transcript: 那么“南橘北枳”这个成语可以成为历史。

translation: In order to organically combine the heredity of breeding with the physiology of cultivation, synthetic agriculture brings hope.
transcript: 为了有机地把育种的遗传性和栽培的生理性结合起来，合成农业带来了希望。

translation: Synthetic agriculture is an efficient breeding system based on the molecular machinery of synthetic biology.
transcript: 而合成农业是基于合成生物学分子模式设计为基础的一种高效的育种体系。

translation: The system consists of all aspects of advanced biotechnology.
transcript: 这种体系包含了先进的生物技术的所有内容。

translation: Including bioinformatics technology, gene editing techniques, gene sequencing technology and protein expression technology.
transcript: 包括生物信息学技术、基因编辑技术、基因测序技术和蛋白质表达技术等。

translation: In other words, we can use our imagination and manually design a system and a module and synthesize them into a new biological system that can help accomplish our goal.
transcript: 也就是说，我们可以用我自己的想象能够人工地去设计一个系统和一个模块儿，合成一个生的生新的生物系统，而这个生物系统呢能够完成我们的目标。

translation: What kind of goal?
transcript: 什么目标？

translation: We can use it to produce the nutrients we need, even vaccines, active proteins, and health supplements.
transcript: 我们可以用它来生产我们所需要的营养物质，甚至疫苗、甚至活性蛋白、施甚至保健品。

translation: We can also transfer all the good traits into one seed.
transcript: 我们也可以把所有优质的性状转入到一个种子当中去。

translation: And by transferring to the microorganisms the entire metabolic pathway of a very expensive drug or active substances that we need.
transcript: 我们也可以把一个我们西需要的非常昂贵的药物或者活性物质的整个的生产合成的代谢途径转入到微生物里，形成一个微生物的工厂。

translation: We can also form a microbial plant by fermentation.
transcript: 通过发酵来实现它。

translation: In 2009, we published a very important paper in the one of journals of the American Society for Microbiology, or ASM.
transcript: 2009年，我们发表了一项非常重要的工作，是在美国微生物的会刊上发表。

translation: The ASM has praised our paper as one of the pioneering projects of green chemistry.
transcript: 美国微生物学会把我们这项工作誉为绿色化学的开创性工作之一。

translation: We transferred an expensive chemical raw material called 1,3-Propanediol, to E. coli.
transcript: 我们把昂贵的一种化学原料1，3-丙二醇转入到了大肠杆菌当中。

translation: The E. coli friendly embraced the entire anabolic pathway of 1,3-Propanediol, which is just like a small factory.
transcript: 而这种大肠杆菌非常友好地接受了1，3-丙二醇整个的合成代谢途径，就像一个小工厂一样。

translation: We moved in.
transcript: 我们搬了进去。

translation: 1,3-Propanediol is a very important chemical in the fields of agriculture, medicine and energy.
transcript: 而1，3-丙二醇是在农业、医药和能源领域非常重要的化学物质。

translation: What's more, the E. coli can transform agricultural waste such as straws to produce 1,3-Propanediol.
transcript: 这还不算，我们大肠杆菌可以利用农业的废弃物，比如说秸秆来生产1，3-丙二醇。

translation: This way helps to greatly reduce the cost and improve the pollution-plagued chemical process.
transcript: 它的成本大幅度地降低，改变了污染严重的化学工艺。

translation: This is our first successful attempt at synthetic biology.
transcript: 这是我们合成生物学一次初步成功的尝试。

translation: In 2016, we combined the advanced genomic rearrangement technology and molecular module techniques to develop a straw mushroom variety resistant to low temperature.
transcript: 2016年，我们运用先进的基因组重排技术和分子模块儿设计的技术相融合，我们构建了耐低温的草菇。

translation: Straw mushrooms are not a new thing to us.
transcript: 草菇大家不陌生。

translation: They are readily available in the summer, but they are quite hard to be found in winter.
transcript: 但是大家经常是在夏天能吃到它，冬天大家很难看到草菇。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Straw mushrooms are very nutritious and they are among the most expensive vegetables in the supermarket in summer. However, they have a unique feature: they tend to resolve at low temperatures.
transcript: 因为草菇有一个特性，虽然它营营养价值非常之高，我看在超市里它的价格是最高的，夏天，它在低温下要自溶。

translation: If we put them in the fridge, they will be dissolved into liquid in less than one night.
transcript: 大家把它放到冰箱里不到一晚上，它就自溶液化了。

translation: This is the cancer of straw mushrooms and many experts want to conquer it.
transcript: 这是草菇的癌症，很多人想把这个癌症攻克。

translation: So do we, what can be done to solve the problem?
transcript: 我们也在想，采取什么样的手段呢？

translation: Finally, we decided to adopt the genomic rearrangement.
transcript: 我们想到了基因组重排技术。

translation: The technology was previously implemented in low-level bacteria such as E. coli and Bacillus subtilis.
transcript: 而这个技术以前是在低等的大肠杆菌和枯草杆菌中实现。

translation: But not in higher organisms and higher fungi.
transcript: 在高等生物当中、高等真菌当中没有实现。

translation: This is no easy task.
transcript: 它很难。

translation: We had to make calculations, and adopt new algorithms, new methods to continuously integrate the two.
transcript: 我们要算，用新的算法，新的方法对它不断地融合。

translation: We selected a large number of straw mushrooms of different varieties from different sources.
transcript: 我们筛选了大量的不同来源的草菇的品种。

translation: And sequenced a large number of genetic genomes of different varieties to obtain different traits.
transcript: 把不同草菇的品种进行大量基因基因组测序，获得它的不同的性状。

translation: Then, we reshuffled these traits, which are represented by the genes, in the ways we imagined.
transcript: 我们把这些性状，也就是基因代表的性状进行重新洗牌，按照我们想象的方式。

translation: And we ended up with a new variety of straw mushroom, which is resistant to low temperatures.
transcript: 我们终于获得了一个新的品种，是耐低温的草菇。

translation: And this time, if we put them in the fridge for two days, they will be just as fresh as the new-picked ones.
transcript: 它放在冰箱里，两天你拿出来，就像新摘下摘出来的一样。

translation: After the article was published in the cover of the journal.
transcript: 文章发表在封面期刊以后。

translation: I received a large number of letters from experts and institutions both at home and abroad.
transcript: 我收到了大量的来信，国内外的专家和西机构的来信。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: They say that this method opens up a new way of breeding edible fungi.
transcript: 他们说，这样一种方法开辟了食用菌育种的一个新的途径。

translation: A project we're working on now is related to corn.
transcript: 现在我们做的一项工作跟玉米有关。

translation: We are trying to develop a very nutritious variety of corn, fresh corn.
transcript: 就是我们在构建一个营养非常好的玉米，鲜食玉米。

translation: You must be very familiar with it.
transcript: 大家都不陌生。

translation: Shanghai is the biggest consumer of fresh corn in China.
transcript: 上海是鲜食玉米消费量最大的地方。

translation: Which is what we often call sweet corn and waxy corn.
transcript: 也就是我们常说的甜玉米和糯玉米。

translation: We are very curious about how we can put the whole synthetic pathway of folic acid into the corn seed.
transcript: 我们想，我们把叶酸它整个的合成途径放到玉米种子当中去。

translation: Why?
transcript: 因为什么呢？

translation: Folic acid is very important nutrient for human beings, but we cannot synthesize it ourselves.
transcript: 叶酸非常重要，是我们人类非常重要的一种营养物质，而我们人类自己却不能合成。

translation: The lack of folic acid will increase the risk of coronary heart disease, Parkinson's syndrome, stroke and other cancers.
transcript: 如果缺乏了叶酸，我们会增加冠心病、帕金综合症、中风以及其他癌症的风险。

translation: If a pregnant woman suffers from a lack of folic acid, it will lead to the underdevelopment of the fetus.
transcript: 孕妇如果缺少了叶酸，会带来胎儿的出生发育的不良。

translation: Every year, 150,000 children around the world are born with defects due to the lack of folic acid.
transcript: 每一年，全世界有15万个孩子因为叶叶酸的缺乏而出生出现出生缺陷。

translation: This is a grave problem.
transcript: 非常严重的问题。

translation: However, we often supplement the artificially synthesized folic acid.
transcript: 但是呢，我们经常会补充人工化学合成的叶酸。

translation: But recent research shows that excessive consumption of such folic acid can increase the risk of colon cancer and prostate cancer.
transcript: 但最新的研究显示，化学合成的叶叶酸过量的食用可以增加结肠癌和前列腺癌的风险。

translation: But if we combine biology, the synthetic agriculture, and the molecular simulation.
transcript: 如果我们通过生物学的方法，通过合成农业的方法，通过分子模拟设计的方法。

translation: We can move the factory-like synthetic pathway of folic acid to fresh corn, and to sweet corn.
transcript: 把叶酸的整个合成途径这个小工厂，搬到了我们鲜食玉米里面，搬到我们甜玉米里面。

translation: And in the near future, a sweet corn could provide the necessary amount of folic acid for one day.
transcript: 未来、不远的将来，大家吃一根甜玉米就能满足一天的叶酸的需求。

translation: What a wonderful thing!
transcript: 这是多好的一件事儿啊！

translation: This picture must be very familiar to you.
transcript: 大家不陌生这张图。

translation: It is the new version of AlphaGo, also known as the Alpha Zero released last October.
transcript: 去年十月，新版的AlphaGo，我们叫Alpha Zero。

translation: This robot, I call it a zero zero dog, is very powerful.
transcript: 我叫它零零狗，非常厉害。

translation: With no prior knowledge of the chess games.
transcript: 它没有任何围棋围棋知识的帮助下。

translation: He conducted 8- hour deep learning and beat the AlphaGo by 100:0, its predecessor who defeated Ke Jie, a world-famous Chinese chess player.
transcript: 自我深度学习了8个小时，以一百比零的比分，战胜了击败柯洁的那个AlphaGo，战胜了它的前辈。

translation: What does this mean?
transcript: 这意味着什么呢？

translation: It means that in just 8 hours, AlphaZero explores and masters the GO, the most complicated chess game, even far better than humans.
transcript: 这意味着它用8个小时，完成了人类对最复杂棋的游戏围棋的理解和探索，甚至远高于人类。

translation: The pace of scientific progress goes far beyond our imagination.
transcript: 科学进步的步伐，远远超出我们的想象。

translation: Just like people who lives 100 years ago and cannot imagine the current way of life.
transcript: 就像我们一百年前，不能想象现在的生活方式一样。

translation: We still can't imagine what kind of life or production model there will be 100 years from now.
transcript: 我们依然不能想象一百年以后，我们是怎样的生活或生产模式。

translation: When artificial intelligence is combined with agriculture, what will it bring?
transcript: 当人工智能与农业结合，会带来怎样的面貌？

translation: It will establish a new management model and system for breeding.
transcript: 它会建立一个全新的育种栽培管理模式和体系。

translation: The cloud biotechnology, which integrates loud computing, big data, and plant biology, has appeared in the United States.
transcript: 集云计算、大数据分析和植物生物学一体的云生物技术，在美国已经诞生。

translation: We can use advanced biosensors to scan the seeds and seedlings just like CT.
transcript: 我们可以利用先进的生物传感器，就像过CT一样，扫描我们的种子和种苗。

translation: Thousands of seedlings are placed around the sensors.
transcript: 成千上万的种苗放在那里.

translation: Where they are quickly arranged by the phenotype, its leaves, its temperature, moisture, stress resistance, physiology and its level of chlorophyll.
transcript: 我们可以快速地去对它进行分拣，快速地感知植物的表型、它的叶片、它的温度、水分、抗逆性、生理性以及它的叶绿素的含量。

translation: This way, we can spot out the best of the seedlings within a short time.
transcript: 这样很短的时间里面，我们在茫茫种苗当中，可以发现了一个最好的。

translation: The seedling is then brought to the breeder, who quickly screens good genes, or modifies its genes to obtain quality agricultural products, which are resistant to diseases, stress and drought.
transcript: 把它拿到以后给我们的育种学家，育种学家可以快速地筛选出优良的基因，或者改良基因，获得我们优质的农产品，抗病、抗逆、抗旱。

translation: Apart from screening high-quality genes, the cloud biotechnology can also monitor the climate, conduct precision irrigation and apply fertilizers.
transcript: 云生物学不仅能够进行良种的优良筛选，而且它还能监测气候，能够精准地实施灌溉和肥料的实施。

translation: These applications have begun to take shape in America.
transcript: 在美国已经有了雏形。

translation: In the tens of thousands of acres of wheat fields.
transcript: 几万亩的小麦田里。

translation: The sensors can calculate how many fertilizers I should apply this year and how much water I should use at each stage.
transcript: 传感器可以知道今年，我要撒多少肥料，这个阶段我能用多少水分。

translation: This greatly reduces costs.
transcript: 极大地节约了成本。

translation: Another interesting project is related to microbes.
transcript: 还有一项有趣的工作就是和微生物相关。

translation: We can screen thousands of microbes in nature.
transcript: 我们可以筛选自然界当中成千上万个微生物。

translation: We didn't have such technology before.
transcript: 以前我们没有这样的技术。

translation: So we just drew pictures on the tablet and learned about some of its preliminary traditional phenotypes.
transcript: 我们只是在平板上画了以后，啊对它一些的初步的传统表型进行了解。

translation: With big data and genetic sequencing now, we can acquire a lot of information, but how?
transcript: 但是我们有大数据，我们有基因测序，我们测序以后，获得很多很多的信息，怎么办？

translation: Machine learning, or deep learning help to classify and decompose the genes, and find the best genes.
transcript: 机器学习，深度学习，它会为我们归类，为我们分解，拿出最优的东西。

translation: It looks for microbes, the friendly microbes.
transcript: 它在寻找微生物，寻找什么微生物，寻找友好的微生物。

translation: Just like our humans, some microbes are in love, some are making friends, and some are playing WeChat.
transcript: 微生物之间和我们人类社会一样，有的在谈恋爱、有的在交朋友、啊有的在玩儿微信，啊。

translation: And some of them are far away and don’t know each other.
transcript: 但是有的远在千里我们不认识。

translation: However, we bring the microbes together so that they can work towards one thing.
transcript: 但是，我们把这些微生物聚集在一起让它们团结协作做一件事情。

translation: What kind of thing?
transcript: 做什么事情呢？

translation: To help the seeds.
transcript: 帮助我们的种子。

translation: So we can find a large number of microbial flora, and plant them in the seeds.
transcript: 于是我们可以找到非常非常多的微生物的菌群，把它定植在种子当中。

translation: Just as a healthy human being must have healthy gut microbes, a healthy seed should also have healthy microbial flora.
transcript: 一个健康的种子它一定含有健康的微生物菌群，就像我们人类一样，一个健康的人他一定包含有健康的肠道微生物。

translation: The healthy seed flora can help seeds to germinate, resist disease and stress, gain nutrients and thrive.
transcript: 这个健康的种子菌群可以帮助种子生根发芽、抗病、抗逆、获取营养物质，茁壮成长。

translation: At the same time, it can also conduct self-reproduction by using 50% of the products of photosynthesis metabolism.
transcript: 而且它自己也可以利用植物光合作用代谢的50%的产物自我繁殖。

translation: Thus forming an organic cycle between seeds, plants and soil.
transcript: 这样就形成了一个种子、植物和土壤之间的有机的循环。

translation: This is also a very harmonious society.
transcript: 这也是一个非常和谐的社会。

translation: Look at this, this is a seed of corn.
transcript: 大家看，这是一粒玉米种子。

translation: What’s the blue part inside?
transcript: 这里边蓝色的是什么呢？

translation: Well, scientists have dyed these microorganisms so that we can see visually the harmonious relation between the microorganisms and the seeds.
transcript: 就是科学家对这些微生物进行了染色，让我们直观地看到它和种子友好地相处。

translation: They help the seeds to grow and resist stress.
transcript: 能够帮助种子促生、抗逆。

translation: In particular, some microorganisms give out antibacterial substances which can kill germs in the soil.
transcript: 特别是有些微生物，它本身能分泌抗菌的物质，它能够杀死在土壤里的病菌。

translation: And if we spray them onto the foliage, we can only reduce the use of pesticides, but get rid of the pests.
transcript: 同时，我们如果把它喷到叶面上，它可以减少农药的使用，它可以杀死病虫害。

translation: Well, one of our projects is related to this.
transcript: 啧我们目前一项工作也是和此相关。

translation: What are we accumulating?
transcript: 我们在富集什么呢？

translation: We are accumulating some of the microbial flora that can conduct biological fixation of nitrogen and get along with each other.
transcript: 我们在富集能够进行生物固氮这样的一些微生物菌菌群，让它们友好地相处。

translation: So that they can quickly and effectively transfer the nitrogen and some other nutrients in the soil to the plants, greatly reducing the use of fertilizers.
transcript: 能够把土壤当中的氮元素非常快地、非常有效地，还有一些养分供给我们的植物，大大地减少化肥的使用。

translation: At the same time, they can also give out anti-bacterial substances.
transcript: 同时，它也能分泌杀菌杀菌物质。

translation: And we can reduce the use of pesticides by spraying them on the leaves. This is our goal.
transcript: 我们喷到叶面上也能够减少农药的使用，这是我们的目标。

translation: In the past 100 years, we have adopted all kinds of techniques in agriculture and ensured the food output meets the needs of human beings.
transcript: 上一个一百年，我们所有的技术运用在农业，打出的粮食，基本能满足我们人类的需求。

translation: But I'm not optimistic about the next 100 years.
transcript: 但是接下来的一百年不容乐观。

translation: And especially by 2030, we will encounter some technological bottlenecks.
transcript: 特别到2030年，我们的一些技术出现瓶颈。

translation: Our population continues to expand, and the food problem has yet to be solved.
transcript: 但是我们的人口在增加，我们粮食问题要解决。

translation: This is not only a problem for us, but for the whole world.
transcript: 不光是我们，是全球是这样一个问题。

translation: As an old saying goes, food is the first necessity of the people, the major source of food is crops, and the major issue with crops is security.
transcript: 我们将经常讲，民以食为天，食以粮为源，粮以安为先。

translation: So the biggest issue is food security.
transcript: 最大的食品安全问题是粮食安全问题。

translation: So we must develop new technologies.
transcript: 我们必须需要新的技术出现。

translation: The Green Revolution in the 1960s achieved the first surge in agricultural production.
transcript: 因为从六十年代开始绿色革命，引起了第一次的农业大增产。

translation: The second Green Revolution in the 1990s was driven by genetic engineering, and we still enjoy its benefits.
transcript: 九十年代第二次绿色革命是由基因工程带动的，我们现在还享受它的它的福利。

translation: By 2020, another green revolution featuring synthetic agriculture technology is coming and we must embrace it with open arms.
transcript: 在2020年，以合成农业技术启动的绿色革命即将到来，我们必须张开双臂拥抱它。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because it can not only significantly increase agricultural productivity.
transcript: 它不仅能够大幅度地提高农业生产力。

translation: But revolutionalize our traditional agricultural production models and bring about a great revolution.
transcript: 而且它能够颠覆我们传统的农业生产模式，带来一个伟大的革命。

translation: When I was young, I was a big fan of music and now I still am.
transcript: 小时候啊，我非常喜欢音乐，现在依然如此。

translation: I used to imagine being a musician or being a composer when I grow up.
transcript: 我曾经想象，长大以后当一个音乐家或者当一个作曲家。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because I have a pair of sensitive ears, and I can understand every note.
transcript: 因为我有一双灵敏的耳朵，我能听懂每一个音符。

translation: I can write down any melody I hear.
transcript: 只要我听到旋律，我就能把它乐谱写下来。

translation: So in college, I wrote a lot of songs and organized a music band.
transcript: 所以大学期间我写了不少的歌曲，也组织过乐队。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢。

translation: So when I read the gene sequences, I often wonder it would be nice if I could translate them into music scores.
transcript: 当我阅读基因序列的时候，我常常在想，如果我能把它翻译出来该多好呀，翻译成乐谱。

translation: Why so?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: This is an interesting topic.
transcript: 这是一个很有趣的话题。

translation: All proteins are composed of 20 kinds of amino acids and are encoded by DNA.
transcript: 蛋白质、任何蛋白质都是由20种氨基酸组成的，是由DNA编码的。

translation: I can translate them, if I can transform them from a vicesimal number to a hexadecimal number.
transcript: 我如果能够把它变成7声音进，从20进制变成7进制，我不就能翻译了嘛。

translation: Then each gene is a musical score, and each anabolic pathway is a movement.
transcript: 那么每一条基因，就是一张乐谱，每一个合成代谢途径就是一个乐章。

translation: It is a wonderful thing that I can hear the melody of the gene expression.
transcript: 我能听到基因表达的旋律，这是多么美好的事情。

translation: The French writer Flaubert once said that science and art are seperated at the base but they will rejoin at the summit.
transcript: 法国作家福楼拜曾说，科学和艺术往往在山麓分手，终会在顶峰汇聚。

translation: The seeds cultivated by synthetic agriculture are the most beautiful artworks that nature has bestowed on me.
transcript: 而合成农业所培育的种子，它就是大自然给予我的最美的艺术品。

translation: I used to regret that I didn't major in music.
transcript: 我曾经很遗憾没有学音乐。

translation: But when I studied life sciences, I realized that it is the most beautiful artistic discipline that nature has given me.
transcript: 但是当我学了生命科学，我才发现这是大自然给我的最美的艺术学科。

translation: The rooting, sprouting, flowering, and fruiting of the seeds are a beautiful melody.
transcript: 你看种子的生根、发芽、开花和结果，富有多么美好的旋律。

translation: It is like a symphony, as colorful as the Sound of Spring.
transcript: 它的内部就像一个交响乐一样，像《春之声》一样绚丽多彩。

translation: If I can write down the melody of seeds, it must be the sound of green, of harvest, and also of life.
transcript: 如果我能谱写下来，那一定是绿色之歌、丰收之歌，也是完美的生命之歌。

translation: And I will make unremitting efforts for this.
transcript: 为此我将不懈努力！

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
